info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:59AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL BEAVER... SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER AND NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 730 AM EDT... At 658 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mars, or near Cranberry, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Franklin Park, Shaler Township, Hampton Township, Economy, O`hara Township, Wexford, Fox Chapel, Harmony Township, and Seven Fields. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 26 and 46. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 70 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
